title: UnitedHealth, Chevron share losses lead Dow's 64-point drop
text:
Dragged down by negative returns for shares of UnitedHealth and Chevron, the Dow Jones Industrial Average is falling Thursday afternoon. The Dow DJIA, -0.22% was most recently trading 64 points lower (-0.2%), as shares of UnitedHealth UNH, -2.77% and Chevron CVX, -1.85% are contributing to the blue-chip gauge's intraday decline. UnitedHealth's shares have fallen $6.47, or 2.9%, while those of Chevron have declined $2.55, or 2.1%, combining for a roughly 61-point drag on the Dow. Other components contributing significantly to the decline include Walt Disney DIS, -1.81%, Johnson & Johnson JNJ, -1.87%, and Cisco CSCO, -1.47%. A $1 move in any of the benchmark's 30 components equates to a 6.78-point swing.

Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights using data from Dow Jones and FactSet. See our market data terms of use.
